data.title: Support open on fullscreen when open vscode via CLI
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.10.2
- OS Version: macOS Sierra

Steps to Reproduce:

Hi, I need submit feature request.
I think if you have flag `-f` to directly open vscode on fullscreen mode it will be nice

Here's available CLI command on **vscode@1.10.2** 

```bash
‚ùØ code --help
Visual Studio Code 1.10.2

Usage: code [options] [paths...]

Options:
  -d, --diff                  Open a diff editor. Requires to pass two file paths as arguments.
  -g, --goto                  Open the file at path at the line and character (add :line[:character] to path).
  --locale <locale>           The locale to use (e.g. en-US or zh-TW).
  -n, --new-window            Force a new instance of Code.
  -p, --performance           Start with the 'Developer: Startup Performance' command enabled.
  -r, --reuse-window          Force opening a file or folder in the last active window.
  --user-data-dir <dir>       Specifies the directory that user data is kept in, useful when running as root.
  --verbose                   Print verbose output (implies --wait).
  -w, --wait                  Wait for the window to be closed before returning.
  --extensions-dir <dir>      Set the root path for extensions.
  --list-extensions           List the installed extensions.
  --show-versions             Show versions of installed extensions, when using --list-extension.
  --install-extension <ext>   Installs an extension.
  --uninstall-extension <ext> Uninstalls an extension.
  --disable-extensions        Disable all installed extensions.
  --disable-gpu               Disable GPU hardware acceleration.
  -v, --version               Print version.
  -h, --help                  Print usage.
```

data.title: Add cursorHardHome
data.body: new

data.title: Remember suggestion selections
data.body:
This is a feature that Sublime 2/3 had that I haven't found in another text editor since switching. Example:

1. I type 'con', and I get a list containing things like 'console', 'const', etc.

2. I use the arrows keys to move my selection to 'const', and hit enter to complete it

3. Next time I type 'con', it would be nice for it to remember that I chose 'const', and highlight that item in the list, so I don't need to scroll to it every time I use it

This seems like a very minor thing, but when you use it in very repetitive languages (CSS, for example), it can save a **ton** of time. Not very familiar with this codebase, but willing to look into it and do a PR if welcome

data.title: Switch to inline View in the git view doesn't persist
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.10.2 (8076a19fdcab7e1fc1707952d652f0bb6c6db331, 2017-03-08T14:02:52.799Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.14393
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|code-gnu-global|austin|0.2.1|
|vscode-markdownlint|DavidAnson|0.7.0|
|githistory|donjayamanne|0.2.0|
|CppSnippets|hars|0.0.7|
|cpptools|ms-vscode|0.10.4|
|csharp|ms-vscode|1.8.0|
|mono-debug|ms-vscode|0.15.3|
|Theme-MarkdownKit|ms-vscode|0.1.1|
|better-merge|pprice|0.5.1|
|Spell|seanmcbreen|0.9.1|
|code-spell-checker|streetsidesoftware|1.0.1|
|spellchecker|swyphcosmo|1.2.9|
|vscode-open-in-github|ziyasal|1.2.3|;


---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. open VS code any github cloned folder and change a couple of files
2. click on the "Git" icon or Ctrl+Shift+G
3. click on one of the modified files to see the changes diff 
4. you will get side-by-side diff windows 
5. click on the "..." located in the top right corner to open the menu and then select "Switch to inline View" and you'll see the view will be correctly switched to inline view 
6. click on other file to see the diff. we'll get the side-by-side view again which I don't expect
7. click on the previous viewed file and you see side-by-side view again will have to go and change it again to inline view from the menu.

Also I didn't find a global setting item allow me to force the inline view to be the default option

data.title: Second prototype of markdown extensions API
data.body:
This implements the new proposal for markdown extensions: https://github.com/mjbvz/vscode-markdown-emoji#api-proposal-take-two-not-yet-implemented

This new API is a mix between the two original concepts: it uses declarative contributions for styles for the preview and an exported API that the markdown extension invokes to add markdown it plugins

data.title: [css] selector-hover: The first child selector is not nested in tooltip

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.10.2 (8076a19fdcab7e1fc1707952d652f0bb6c6db331, 2017-03-08T14:00:46.854Z)
- OS Version: Linux x64 4.4.0-66-generic
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|code-settings-sync|Shan|2.5.1|
|RustyCode|saviorisdead|0.19.1|
|Material-theme|zhuangtongfa|2.1.7|;


---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Make a new CSS file
2. Create a selector like `.my-class>.my-nested-class>.my-very-nested-class`
3. Hover over the selector

The tooltip looks like:
```
<element class="my-class">
<element class="my-nested-class">
     <element class="my-very-nested-class">
```

While it should be:
```
<element class="my-class">
     <element class="my-nested-class">
          <element class="my-very-nested-class">
```

data.title: Consider fullwidth characters when rendering tabs

data.body:
1. Have two foldable regions back to back in code
2. Fold the first region
3. Press "down" to highlight the line and have the cursor be at the start of the next line
4. Press "backspace"

**Expected:** The folded section is deleted but the remaining section stays formatted as it was

**Actual:** The second section folds as shown below

data.title: Powershell not respecting execution policy setting
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.10.2 (8076a19fdcab7e1fc1707952d652f0bb6c6db331, 2017-03-08T14:02:52.799Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 6.1.7601
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|javadebugger|donjayamanne|0.0.2|
|python|donjayamanne|0.6.0|
|auto-close-tag|formulahendry|0.3.10|
|output-colorizer|IBM|0.0.11|
|tabsanity|jedmao|0.0.9|
|vscode-rust|kalitaalexey|0.3.10|
|csharp|ms-vscode|1.8.0|
|PowerShell|ms-vscode|0.10.1|
|Ruby|rebornix|0.10.4|
|java|redhat|0.0.12|
|vscode-icons|robertohuertasm|7.3.0|
|change-case|wmaurer|1.0.0|;


---

I'm on 64-bit Windows 7 using the default integrated terminal (so cmd.exe). When I open a terminal session and then switch to Powershell by typing "powershell," I get an error message:

```
File C:\Users\Me\Documents\WindowsPowerShell\Microsoft.PowerShell_profile.ps1 cannot be loaded because running scripts is disabled on this system. For more information, see about_Execution_Polic
http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=135170.At line:1 char:3
+ . 'C:\Users\frys\Documents\WindowsPowerShell\Microsoft.PowerShell_pro ...
+   ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
    + CategoryInfo          : SecurityError: (:) [], PSSecurityException
    + FullyQualifiedErrorId : UnauthorizedAccess
```

What's happening is that the Powershell session opened in the integrated terminal isn't using the execution policy setting that I have.

Running Get-ExecutionPolicy in native powershell.exe or a Powershell session opened in native cmd.exe returns "RemoteSigned," but running Get-ExecutionPolicy in the integrated terminal session returns "Restricted" (I believe that's the default setting).

Powershell does open and functions fine, but if I had my own scripts that I wanted to load and execute I believe I would run into problems.

data.title: Cannot set breakpoints in Meteor builds of node server app
data.body:
I connected with @weinand, on my [stackoverflow](http://stackoverflow.com/questions/42640867/cannot-set-breakpoints-in-meteor-node-app-with-vs-code) posting.  Adding issue as requested.

- VSCode Version: 1.10.2
- OS Version: Windows 10 Version 1607 (OS Build 14393.953)
- Meteor: 1.4.3.2 (includes node v4.8)

### Steps to Reproduce:
1. **in VS Code**: configure `launch.json` attach:
```
  {
    "name": "Attach to Server",
    "type": "node",
    "request": "attach",
    "port": 5838,
    "address": "localhost",
    "restart": true,
    "timeout": 20000,
    "sourceMaps": true,
    "protocol": "legacy",
    "outFiles": ["${workspaceRoot}/meris/.meteor/local/build/programs/server/**/*.js"]
  }
```
2. **in CMD Shell:** set `NODE_OPTIONS` environment variable `set NODE_OPTIONS=--debug=5838`
3. **in CMD Shell:** start meteor: `meteor`
4. **in VS Code:** set a breakpoint on a source file clicking in far left column and get bright red indicator.
5. **in VS Code:** attach to the process.  Successfully attaches
6. **in webapp (connected to server):** execute function that will execute code where breakpoint is set.

### Result:
Does not stop debugger at breakpoint set in my source file.

### Other observations:
- if I put a `debugger;` statement into the code
1. The debugger will break on the debugger statement and I can interact with the code using the VS Code debugger;
2. The debugger does not break in my source code, it brings up another tab with the source code in it.  The source code has a sub-title "_read-only inlined content from source map_".  And the file location is at `\1001\`.

- if instead of attaching a VS Code debugger, I attach `node-inspector` everything works as I expect.  After attaching `node-inspector` all of my set breakpoints hit.  No `debugger;` statements required.
1. After step 3 above: **in CMD shell**: `node-debug --debug-port=5838`
2. Breakpoints set in `node-inspector` hit as expected.

- I understand source maps in concept, but I do not understand the format of the file.  But in the sources array, the references to my source files look like this

> `"meteor://üíªapp/server/main.js"`

It looks a little odd to me... what is with this üíª character?

- #7117 touches on this problem.  But more research was not performed.  Also, note that meteor now uses node v4.8 instead of  node v0.10.43

### Comments
- Let me know if there are some questions you need answered from the Meteor Development Team.  I will see if I can get them to engage.
- Let me know if you need any other repro information.

data.title: cmd+shift+f (Find in Files) should not focus the editor
data.body:
The current behavior is that pressing `cmd+shift+f` toggles between the editor and the side panel, but this drives me crazy as I need to check my focus before pressing (or not pressing) that combo when doing a lot of hunting around. 

The number of times I've accidentally typed my search into a random file instead of the search field is painful. Please make cmd+shift+f always focus the search field, or at least allow for such an option.

Thanks!

data.title: Allow the Terminal window to "pop out" from editor
data.body:
After some discussion on the PowerShell VSCode extension, i was instructed to put the request in the VSCode repo.

https://github.com/PowerShell/vscode-powershell/issues/577

But the ability to pop the terminal window out of the editor window would be very nice!  It was one of the very few reasons i purchased ISESteriods when using the PowerShell_ISE.

Thanks

data.title: Debug viewlet keyboard inconsistency
data.body:
I can tab from the debug launch button to the config dropdown, but I can't use the left/right arrow keys to focus it. But I can use the arrow keys to switch between the other 3 controls at the top of the viewlet. And since the arrow keys expand the dropdown, it would be nicer if I could just use the arrow keys to do both things.

I think you worked on this @michelkaporin?

data.title: Comment Line Command Causes Syntax Errors Inside JSX Elements
data.body: If I use "cmd+k cmd+k" to comment single line on JS code inside JSX element VS Code fails to commenting code. Before commenting: When I comment the line. It now has a syntax error - VSCode Version: 1.10.2 - OS Version: macOS Sierra 10.12.2
